examples: Small cracks appeared in the wall.
Ken made a few cracks about the movie.
That detail must have slipped between the cracks.
We were up at the crack of dawn.
The private finance initiative has not papered over the cracks, although it has lined plenty of pockets.
words.defineEn: to break on the surface without falling into separate pieces
words.defineVi: để phá vỡ trên bề mặt mà không rơi vào mảnh riêng biệt

examples: The out-of-town shopping center will kill local trade.
The out-of-town shopping center will kill local trade.
To learn a language/skill/trade.
People were tempted into the trade by the thought of easy money.
All pretence at unity went out of the window as cabinet colleagues traded insults.
words.defineEn: to buy and sell or to exchange items of value
words.defineVi: để mua và bán hoặc trao đổi các mặt hàng có giá trị

examples: He enabled him to take the cheap shot that ended the fight, stirred the pot and kept Mayweather at the center of controversy.
The fingerprints left on the door-handle was the smoking gun that enabled the police to arrest him.
Biden White House with a Democratic Congress will enable tax reform, a large covid package in the first quarter, health care reform potentially.
These efficiencies in combination with the advantages of electric propulsion, enable an entirely new type of flight: air taxis or urban air mobility.
Precision manufacturing enabled the production of interchangeable parts at scale.
words.defineEn: to give someone or something the means or ability to do something
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó phương tiện hoặc khả năng để làm điều gì đó

examples: The police apprehended the thief and recovered the stolen items.
The police officer arrested the thief and recovered the stolen items.
Emily had just recovered from her illness and was now in the pink of health.
Alice was given a new lease on life after she recovered from her illness.
To recover his glasses, the scientist darted to his car like a scalded cat and clambered quickly in.
words.defineEn: to regain complete health after a period of sickness or injury
words.defineVi: để lấy lại sức khỏe hoàn toàn sau một thời gian bị bệnh hoặc chấn thương

examples: The hollow macaroni tubes absorb the flavorful broth in the soup.
The bathroom rug absorbs water and prevents slipping on the floor.
As the rain poured, the thirsty plant absorbed water through its roots, nourishing its leaves and stems.
To absorb the lesson, I had to do it over.
The nets absorb the energy from a truck collision.
words.defineEn: to take in energy, liquid, etc.
words.defineVi: để tiếp nhận năng lượng, chất lỏng, v.v.

examples: We had to cancel our outdoor plans due to the stormy weather.
They had a bad hair day on their vacation, encountering unexpected weather, canceled plans, and lost luggage.
The wheels fell off her career when she started taking drugs and cancelling concerts.
In the event that the performance is canceled, you can get your money back.
No, it got canceled, so I'm off the hook
words.defineEn: to decide or tell that something arranged before will now not happen
words.defineVi: để quyết định hoặc nói rằng một cái gì đó sắp xếp trước đây sẽ không xảy ra

examples: My assistant is threatening to leave.
They're threatening to go on strike again.
They threatened to beat my brains in if I ever came here again.
Dad threatened to stop £1 a week from our pocket money if we didn't clean our rooms.
Emergency aid could save millions threatened with starvation.
words.defineEn: to say that one is willing to damage something or hurt someone if one's demands are not met
words.defineVi: để nói rằng một người sẵn sàng làm hỏng một cái gì đó hoặc làm tổn thương ai đó nếu nhu cầu của một người không được đáp ứng

examples: The judge will have the last word on the divorce agreement.
The judge allowed my claim.
The judge brought his hammer down on the table.
The judge stood firm in her ruling.
People often judge a book by its cover without reading the contents.
words.defineEn: to form a decision or opinion based on what one knows
words.defineVi: để hình thành một quyết định hoặc ý kiến dựa trên những gì một người biết

examples: The government has denied that the events ever happened.
But officials deny they've been keeping their proposals under wraps.
Sources close to the bank have denied suggestions that heads will roll following the huge losses reported this week.
Mark couldn't deny that he had the hots for his coworker, Lisa.
He appeared on national television to deny the claims.
words.defineEn: to declare that something is not true
words.defineVi: để tuyên bố rằng một cái gì đó là không đúng sự thật

examples: The open window let in a cool breeze.
I dipped my feet in the cool water of the river.
I'd give my right arm for a nice cool drink.
She pressed her cheek against the cool glass window.
He completely lost his cool and started yelling.
words.defineEn: to become less hot and slightly colder
words.defineVi: trở nên ít nóng hơn và lạnh hơn một chút

examples: My grandma bakes a delicious persimmon pie every Thanksgiving.
My grandmother baked a batch of foxtail millet and chocolate chip cookies for us.
She baked a batch of delicious hazelnut cookies.
I baked a chocolate cake for my friend's birthday.
Yesterday he baked a loaf of whole wheat bread.
words.defineEn: to cook food, usually in an oven, without extra fat or liquid
words.defineVi: nấu thức ăn, thường là trong lò nướng, không có thêm chất béo hoặc chất lỏng

examples: The house rules are crystal clear.
The teacher ruled the classroom with a heavy hand, rarely allowing any freedom or creativity.
She explained the rules of the game to the new players.
In this particular society men rule the roost and women have a low status and few rights.
The new rules should help cut the red tape for farmers.
words.defineEn: to control and be in charge of a country
words.defineVi: kiểm soát và chịu trách nhiệm về một quốc gia

examples: So, Muslim scholars translated hundreds of thousands of manuscripts from Greek, Roman, Persian, Indian, and Egyptian scientists into Arabic.
These Army artists and architects translate the printed pages of a training film's script into practical terms of detailed sketches and architectural floor plans and blueprints.
Generally, more dopamine translates to a greater feeling of reward.
Choose "Translate document."
In fact, German automaker Volkswagen's brand name translates to people's car making and selling.
words.defineEn: to change words into another language
words.defineVi: để thay đổi từ sang ngôn ngữ khác

examples: His ace in the hole is his political influence.
His paintings had a strong influence on me as a student.
Iranian cuisine is influenced by various Asian flavors, making it a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern and Asian culinary traditions.
He saw that his unhealthy habits were influencing his children's behavior, as like breeds like.
They got into trouble with the law for driving under the influence.
words.defineEn: to have an effect on someone or something
words.defineVi: để có ảnh hưởng đến một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: Both men wore confident smiles.
She smiled nervously.
She had a big smile on her face.
The old gentleman greeted everyone with a warm smile.
His wife smiled, recalling the old saying that a man is a lion in his own cause.
words.defineEn: to make our mouth curve upwards, often in a way that our teeth can be seen, to show that we are happy or amused
words.defineVi: làm cho miệng của chúng ta cong lên, thường theo cách có thể nhìn thấy răng của chúng ta, để thể hiện rằng chúng ta đang vui vẻ hoặc thích thú

examples: If you enjoy solving puzzles and riddles, this escape room experience will float your boat.
During the summer vacation, camping and hiking in the mountains floated their boat and created lasting memories.
Different genres of music appeal to different people, and for me, classical music really floats my boat.
As the sun beat down, they relaxed on the beach, sipping on cold beverages with slices of lime rind floating on top.
I love lying on the grass and watching the clouds float across the sky.
words.defineEn: to be in motion on a body of water or current of air at a slow pace
words.defineVi: đang chuyển động trên một vùng nước hoặc luồng không khí với tốc độ chậm

examples: I'm willing to accept some minor edits on my script, but I draw a line at any major rewrites.
In other words, to repeat in order to make myself perfectly clear, he made the edits and he wasted my time.
When the client requested a change in the design, the graphic designer made the edits no sooner said than done.
We edit YouTube videos.
Edited by Stan and Mark Olsen.
words.defineEn: to choose and arrange the parts that are crucial to the story of a movie, show, etc. and cut out unnecessary ones
words.defineVi: chọn và sắp xếp các phần quan trọng đối với câu chuyện của một bộ phim, chương trình, v.v. và cắt bỏ những phần không cần thiết

examples: The rebels succeeded in taking the town.
The announcement only succeeded in creating confusion.
Opponents have succeeded in planting the seeds of doubt in our team.
In the end, she succeeded because nothing is impossible to a willing heart.
Without a good plan, our project doesn't stand a chance of succeeding.
words.defineEn: to reach or achieve what one desired or tried for
words.defineVi: để đạt được hoặc đạt được những gì một mong muốn hoặc cố gắng cho

examples: Commuters packed like sardines on the evening train.
I packed an extra jacket for the camping trip.
My sister packed some Spanish limes in her picnic basket for a tangy snack on our outdoor adventure.
We packed sandwiches for our picnic in the park.
She packed a small bag of peanuts for her road trip.
words.defineEn: to put clothes and other things needed for travel into a bag, suitcase, etc.
words.defineVi: để quần áo và những thứ khác cần thiết cho chuyến du lịch vào túi xách, vali, v.v.

examples: The immigration officer reviewed my passport before granting entry.
The magazine features interviews with musicians and reviews of new albums.
She left a positive review online for the restaurant where she ordered a pizza.
The newspaper has an entertainment section with movie reviews and celebrity news.
Melissa's new book got off to a flying start, with high sales and positive reviews from readers and critics alike.
words.defineEn: to reconsider something, especially in order to make a decision about it or make modifications to it
words.defineVi: để xem xét lại một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là để đưa ra quyết định về nó hoặc sửa đổi nó

examples: Her recent conduct is beyond the pale.
The court held that such conduct violated the statute.
I enjoy conducting experiments and making observations in science class.
Even though he came from a humble background, John's refined manners and impeccable conduct showed that it takes three generations to make a gentleman.
Before investing in a new business venture, it's important to conduct thorough research and assess potential risks.
words.defineEn: to direct or participate in the management of something
words.defineVi: để chỉ đạo hoặc tham gia vào việc quản lý của một cái gì đó

examples: Both drivers shared the blame for the accident.
Quite frankly, I don't blame you.
No one would blame the South Windsor High boys soccer team for feeling fit to be tied.
Shouldn't we now be acknowledging blame rather than passing the buck?
According to recent polls, the finger of blame is pointing squarely at the president for the recent economic downturn.
words.defineEn: to say or feel that someone or something is at fault
words.defineVi: để nói hoặc cảm thấy rằng một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó là có lỗi

examples: They were arrested in the small hours of Saturday morning.
The police officer arrested the thief and recovered the stolen items.
50 police officers to arrest two unarmed men is surely using a sledgehammer to crack a nut.
He was arrested for breaking and entering.
The police officers tore the suspect out of the car and arrested him.
words.defineEn: (of law enforcement agencies) to take a person away because they believe that they have done something illegal
words.defineVi: (của các cơ quan thực thi pháp luật) để đưa một người đi vì họ tin rằng họ đã làm điều gì đó bất hợp pháp

examples: Double cream adds indulgence to creamy pasta sauces.
His parents did a double take when he came home with a tattoo.
The kitchen had a double oven, allowing for simultaneous baking of different dishes.
Take your hot beverages to the next level by adding a splash of double cream to them.
When the price of skiing doubled, tourists voted with their feet and just stopped going.
words.defineEn: to make something experience a twofold increase
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó kinh nghiệm tăng gấp đôi

examples: He danced the issue around.
As the wind blew gently, the silver-gray leaves of artemisia danced in the breeze.
She attends a dance class every Thursday to learn new moves.
Asian cultures have a rich heritage of art, music, and dance.
He always dances around the topic of pay raises for my team whenever I bring it up to him.
words.defineEn: to move the body to music in a special way
words.defineVi: để di chuyển cơ thể âm nhạc trong một cách đặc biệt
